did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections and University Archives, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: This collection contains a ledger recording customer transactions of Wise County, Virginia general mercantile store operated by Henry I. Mullins.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: The copyright status of this collection is unknown. Copyright restrictions may apply. Contact Special Collections and University Archives for assistance in determining the use of these materials. Reproduction or digitization of materials for personal or research use can be requested using our reproduction/digitization form: http://bit.ly/scuareproduction. Reproduction or digitization of materials for publication or exhibit use can be requested using our publication/exhibition form: http://bit.ly/scuapublication. Please contact Special Collections and University Archives (specref@vt.edu or 540-231-6308) if you need assistance with forms or to submit a completed form.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: [identification of item], [box], [folder], Henry I. Mullins Account Book, Ms1940-024, Special Collections and University Archives, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Henry I. Mullins Account Book was donated to the university in 1939 and transferred to Special Collections and University Archives in 1955.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing and description of the Henry I. Mullins Account Book commenced and was completed in March 2011. Initial description was completed in or prior to May 1970.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Henry I. Mullins, the son of James H. and Lucinda Bowling Mullins, was born in Kentucky on February 7, 1874. He appears in the Letcher County, Kentucky home of his father in the 1880 census. In 1893, Mullins married Mattie Williams (1877-1963). The couple would have at least six children and continue through 1920 to live in Letcher County, where they engaged in farming. A notation in Mullins' account book notes that he started business in Pound (Wise County), Virginia in 1921. Henry I. Mullins died on March 30, 1951, and is buried in the Bolling Cemetery of Pound, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a single account book maintained by Henry I. Mullins, the proprietor of a general mercantile store in Wise County, Virginia. The volume contains entries detailing customer names, goods purchased, and prices for 1921. Commencing in 1923, the entries seem to record only the expenses of the Jones and Combs partnership. The entries end in 1924.

odd.head: Rights Statement for Archival Description
